version_description: We're always making Deezer better, so keep your Updates turned on to make sure you don't miss anything good.
We're always making Deezer better, so keep your Updates turned on to make sure you don't miss anything good.
We're always making Deezer better, so keep your Updates turned on to make sure you don't miss anything good.

You can plan a pretty picnic but you can't predict the weather. Neither can we, but we can help you find the sound of your summer with some awesome new features.

- You can now swipe right on the home screen for even more album, mix and playlist recommendations.

- We've added Channels - the new place to find all the music and news for whatever genre, mood or podcasts you're into. You'll find these on the new home screen too, just click Explore and dive in to the world of Hip Hop, Chill Out, News and more.

- Listen to all your favorite radio stations live, get instant track ID and add music to your favorites as you hear it. You'll find radio stations by Channel and you can favorite a track just by tapping the heart in the Player.
They came, they saw and they did not conquer. We have fixed a few annoying bugs here and there for a silky smooth product.

- Looking good app!
The app is even clearer than before. Check out the new artist page layout on iPhone and iPad. You can now see all their albums and playlists at a glance and swipe to find similar artists. 

- We've made a few improvements so your app can run like clockwork.

- Looking good app! The app is even clearer than before. Check out the new artist page layout on iPhone and iPad. You can now see all their albums and playlists at a glance and swipe to find similar artists. 

- We've made a few improvements so your app can run like clockwork.

Holidays are over, sob (hand us a tissue).  

Some bugs are harder to squish than others. We still haven’t managed to squash ours, which has been pestering us over the past few weeks. But this bug’s holidays are over and its days are counted. We won’t give up until the nuisance is crushed.   

In the meantime we got rid of some other bugs so you can enjoy your app to the fullest.

Some bugs are harder to squish than others. We still haven’t managed to squash ours, which has been pestering us over the past few weeks. But this bug’s holidays are over and its days are counted. We won’t give up until the nuisance is crushed.   

In the meantime we got rid of some other bugs so you can enjoy your app to the fullest.

Holidays are over, sob (hand us a tissue).

Some bugs are harder to squish than others. We still haven’t managed to squash ours, which has been pestering us over the past few weeks. But this bug’s holidays are over and its days are counted. We won’t give up until the nuisance is crushed. 

In the meantime we got rid of some other bugs so you can enjoy your app to the fullest.

Holidays are over, sob (hand us a tissue).

Some bugs are harder to squish than others. We still haven’t managed to squash ours, which has been pestering us over the past few weeks. But this bug’s holidays are over and its days are counted. We won’t give up until the nuisance is crushed. 

In the meantime we got rid of some other bugs so you can enjoy your app to the fullest.

- Forgetting the name of an artist or playlist is frustrating. Forgetting the name when you loose the signal is worse. But those days are over! Now you can type the first letters in ‘Search’ and Deezer will find the closest match in your downloaded library.

- Getting into the party mood or dozing off on the couch? Create a playlist for any occasion in under 20 seconds. Go to My Music then playlists, tap on the + icon and start adding music, easy as pie.

- We've worked extra hard this month, just thought you might like to know.
We've been tinkering about, testing some new tricks, tying up a few loose ends and fixing a few hitches on the Deezer app for Apple Watch.

- Forgetting the name of an artist or playlist is frustrating. Forgetting the name when you loose the signal is worse. But those days are over! Now you can type the first letters in ‘Search’ and Deezer will find the closest match in your downloaded library.

- Getting into the party mood or dozing off on the couch? Create a playlist for any occasion in under 20 seconds. Go to My Music then playlists, tap on the + icon and start adding music, easy as pie.

- We've worked extra hard this month, just thought you might like to know.
We've been tinkering about, testing some new tricks, tying up a few loose ends and fixing a few hitches on the Deezer app for Apple Watch.

Get on the fast track to your music!
When your top two favorite artists are Arcade Fire and ZZ Top, you've got a lot of music to scroll through to get to them. So, to save your thumbs from fatigue, we've added an A-Z super scroll to My Music. Just pick the first letter of what you're looking for and jump over everyone else.

Raise the bar. 
If you're into a genre or in a certain mood, you can now search by Channel. And we've also added Live Radio results to Search, so you can check out your favorite radio stations right in the app.

Get on the fast track to your music!
When your top two favorite artists are Arcade Fire and ZZ Top, you've got a lot of music to scroll through to get to them. So, to save your thumbs from fatigue, we've added an A-Z super scroll to My Music. Just pick the first letter of what you're looking for and jump over everyone else.

Raise the bar. 
If you're into a genre or in a certain mood, you can now search by Channel. And we've also added Live Radio results to Search, so you can check out your favorite radio stations right in the app.

Go down to go up.  
You’ve reached the best part of your favorite song, time to pump up the volume. Tap Audio below the player to access your audio settings and the equalizer. Your queue is located on the right hand side.

Tis the season to be sharing.
Found an awesome track you simply must share? Send it to a friend on iMessage. They can enjoy a 30 second extract without leaving iMessage. Premium+ users can listen to the full song in their Deezer app. Available for iOS 10 users only.

- With the New Year comes new resolutions. They might be to use that expensive gym membership, try a gluten-free recipe book and even stop swearing like a fu***ng sailor. Or, you could cut yourself some slack and listen to the one thing that won’t let you down in 2017: your music on Deezer. Plus you can now create a playlist straight in the playlist tab on your iPad. 

- We've destroyed a few bugs in the app to get 2017 off to a good start.

We’ve replaced the gray menu in your app with a clear white background. Apparently white makes spaces look bigger and brighter or so interior designers say. 

- We’ve been tinkering with the Deezer app for iWatch to make your experience even better. This includes a new display menu which gives you immediate access to My Music, your albums, playlists and podcasts.

-Refresh
Bad case of music amnesia? No problem, you can now see your most recent activity. Whether you want to find that cool track in your Flow or listen to an album, playlist or podcast again, simply go to My Music and access up to 12 previous streams.

And, because it’s the little things that matter, we’ve gone the extra mile to help you remember your music. You'll now find your recently played albums in your Albums tab, updated playlists in your Playlists and your most recently downloaded music for offline listening. 

-Playlistception 
Create a new playlist from one of your existing playlists. Change the title, description, picture and voilà! A shiny new playlist.

-Peek and Pop 
Press down on an album or playlist to launch an extract of the audio content and preview more info: zoom in on the cover, number of tracks and duration.
Available from iPhone 6s onwards.

Your app’s looking as fresh as a daisy with a new player that displays the entire name of the song and artist you’re listening to. We’ve also grouped some icons together with a few animated effects to make everything so much easier.

Your app’s looking as fresh as a daisy with a new player that displays the entire name of the song and artist you’re listening to. We’ve also grouped some icons together with a few animated effects to make everything so much easier.

- Play right here, right now. 

See the little Play icon on the left-hand side of every cover? Tap on it to listen to an album, podcast or radio. The new shortcut is available in your music collection, on your homepage and in every channel. For Premium+ members only. 

- Sleep soundly!

Fall asleep to the sweet sound of music without draining the battery. You can automatically stop playing your music after a set time with our clever little timer. Only available in Deezer Labs.

- Life’s little victories 
We’ve tweaked the design in the My Music section, take a peek.
We've been busy as bees improving the app. Voila!
We've been busy as bees improving the app. Voila!
We've been busy as bees improving the app. Voila!

-Stir it up. 

Add, remove and change the order of your tracks in Queue. Not available on Chromecast.

-Deezer jogs your memory.

Search now allows you to view your last five searches and the 5 most popular searches on Deezer.

-The playlist that just keeps going
You can now add one entire playlist to another playlist. Try mixing your ‘rapper’s delight’ playlist with your classical playlist. Whoever said you couldn’t dab to Bach? 

-As smooth as Chrome wheels, baby
We’ve improved Deezer on Chromecast by swatting a few bugs. You can now cruise your way through Deezer on your TV.

-The playlist that just keeps going
You can now add one entire playlist to another playlist. Try mixing your ‘rapper’s delight’ playlist with your classical playlist. Whoever said you couldn’t dab to Bach? 

-As smooth as Chrome wheels, baby
We’ve improved Deezer on Chromecast by swatting a few bugs. You can now cruise your way through Deezer on your TV.

-The playlist that just keeps going
You can now add one entire playlist to another playlist. Try mixing your ‘rapper’s delight’ playlist with your classical playlist. Whoever said you couldn’t dab to Bach? 

-As smooth as Chrome wheels, baby
We’ve improved Deezer on Chromecast by swatting a few bugs. You can now cruise your way through Deezer on your TV.

- New on Artist pages
Discover albums featuring an artist outside of their own discography.

- We've fixed a bunch of bugs:

Well, that's refreshing.
On your Playlists page on iPhone and Mixes page on iPad, you can now pull down to refresh.

Lost in space
On iPad, a search bar used to appear in the middle of the list when you sorted your favorite artists A-Z. We found it and got rid.

Who's that guy?
Bugs that popped up when displaying playlist covers and creator profile pictures have been fixed.

- Hello, anybody here?
Did we just see some tumbleweed roll through your empty Albums section? Start filling it up with awesome music by heading to our channel dedicated to all the new sounds, bangers and albums picked just for you.

- Hello, anybody here?
Did we just see some tumbleweed roll through your empty Albums section? Start filling it up with awesome music by heading to our channel dedicated to all the new sounds, bangers and albums picked just for you.

-As chance would have it: 
Listen to all your downloaded tracks on shuffle. 
Available to Deezer Premium+ members only.

-As chance would have it: 
Listen to all your downloaded tracks on shuffle. 
Available to Deezer Premium+ members only.

- Pick up from where you left off. 
Haven’t finished sorting out your playlists? Now, when you quit and re-open your app, you’ll land on the last opened tab, so you can continue whatever it is you were up to.

- Pick up from where you left off. 
Haven’t finished sorting out your playlists? Now, when you quit and re-open your app, you’ll land on the last opened tab, so you can continue whatever it is you were up to.

- Don’t skip a beat
No more music FOMO with Deezer. When you tap on an artist page, you’ll find their latest release at the top of the page just under their top tracks. You’ll never miss another release from the artists you love.

We've also been busy fixing a few bugs here and there on Chromecast, so that the app runs like a charm.

- Don’t skip a beat
No more music FOMO with Deezer. When you tap on an artist page, you’ll find their latest release at the top of the page just under their top tracks. You’ll never miss another release from the artists you love.

We've also been busy fixing a few bugs here and there on Chromecast, so that the app runs like a charm.

- A clean slate. 
Sometimes less is more, which is why we’ve removed the blue background from the “Recently Played” section.

- No signal? No sweat
Losing the signal while playing Flow is a pain. Now Deezer launches your downloaded tracks in shuffle mode when Flow cuts off. For Premium+ subscribers only.

- Everyday you're shufflin' shufflin'
Live the unexpected and shuffle your entire music collection. Click on "Shuffle My Music" in the "My Music" tab. Available to Premium+ members only.

- Everyday you're shufflin' shufflin'
Live the unexpected and shuffle your entire music collection. Click on "Shuffle My Music" in the "My Music" tab. Available to Premium+ members only.

- Everyday you're shufflin' shufflin'
Live the unexpected and shuffle your entire music collection. Click on "Shuffle My Music" in the "My Music" tab. Available to Premium+ members only.

- Music is better with friends
We've fixed a bug on Facebook Messenger sharing, so you can now share a direct listening link instead of just the album cover.

- The big wheel keeps on turning
If you open an Artists page, we've fixed the bug that caused the loading wheel to get stuck at the top and we've also reinstated the most-listened sort functionality.

- Music is better with friends
We've fixed a bug on Facebook Messenger sharing, so you can now share a direct listening link instead of just the album cover.

- The big wheel keeps on turning
If you open an Artists page, we've fixed the bug that caused the loading wheel to get stuck at the top and we've also reinstated the most-listened sort functionality.

- Music is better with friends
We've fixed a bug on Facebook Messenger sharing, so you can now share a direct listening link instead of just the album cover.

- The big wheel keeps on turning
If you open an Artists page, we've fixed the bug that caused the loading wheel to get stuck at the top and we've also reinstated the most-listened sort functionality.

- Two birds with one stone
If you've already logged in to your Deezer account on the web using Safari and activated iCloud keychain, you can now save time when you connect on your iPhone: your email address and password are already there, pre-filled, waiting for you.
Only on iOS 11

- Away from the internet, near the music / volume 1
Don't go further than the "Recently Played" section in "My Music" to listen again, even offline. From now on you can play downloaded content direct from "Recently Played" even when the connection jumps, the bug has been solved.

- Away from the internet, near the music / volume 2
Want to shuffle everything in" My Music" but don't have the internet? Now you can start playback even when you are offline and listen to your already downloaded tracks, the bug has been fixed.

- Settings is now beefier
You can find all your profile info (name, photo, followers etc) by tapping the Settings icon in My Music.

- Settings is now beefier
You can find all your profile info (name, photo, followers etc) by tapping the Settings icon in My Music.

- Settings is now beefier
You can find all your profile info (name, photo, followers etc) by tapping the Settings icon in My Music.

- Settings is now beefier
You can find all your profile info (name, photo, followers etc) by tapping the Settings icon in My Music.

- Two birds with one stone
If you've already logged in to your Deezer account on the web using Safari and activated iCloud keychain, you can now save time when you connect on your iPhone: your email address and password are already there, pre-filled, waiting for you.
Only on iOS 11

- Away from the internet, near the music / volume 1
Don't go further than the "Recently Played" section in "My Music" to listen again, even offline. From now on you can play downloaded content direct from "Recently Played" even when the connection jumps, the bug has been solved.

- Away from the internet, near the music / volume 2
Want to shuffle everything in" My Music" but don't have the internet? Now you can start playback even when you are offline and listen to your already downloaded tracks, the bug has been fixed.

- Open Sesame
We've fixed the bug that stopped the player opening when you press play on one of your automatically generated playlists, so you can enjoy the full glory of your music.

- Queue the music
Revisiting your queue list? We've solved the problem that prevented you replaying your tracks after your queue finished.

- Flow just got better
You asked for more ways to enjoy Flow, and we listened. We've moved it to its own tab and beefed it up with 2 new curated playlist types made just for you. 'Inspired by' is a regularly refreshed collection based on the artists you've been listening to lately, while 'Discover' is full of music you've never heard before. You'll find Notifications in My Music.

- Knowledge is power
Play something now and you'll find a wealth of information in the new carousel at the top of every album, artist, playlist and podcast page.

- Things we've fixed
We've fixed the refresh on pages like Home and Channels, and the empty state for Search so you see trending queries.

- Flow just got better
You asked for more ways to enjoy Flow, and we listened. We've moved it to its own tab and beefed it up with 2 new curated playlist types made just for you. 'Inspired by' is a regularly refreshed collection based on the artists you've been listening to lately, while 'Discover' is full of music you've never heard before. You'll find Notifications in My Music.

- Knowledge is power
Play something now and you'll find a wealth of information in the new carousel at the top of every album, artist, playlist and podcast page.

- Things we've fixed
We've fixed the refresh on pages like Home and Channels, and the empty state for Search so you see trending queries.

- Flow just got better
You asked for more ways to enjoy Flow, and we listened. We've moved it to its own tab and beefed it up with 2 new curated playlist types made just for you. 'Inspired by' is a regularly refreshed collection based on the artists you've been listening to lately, while 'Discover' is full of music you've never heard before. You'll find Notifications in My Music.

- Knowledge is power
Play something now and you'll find a wealth of information in the new carousel at the top of every album, artist, playlist and podcast page.

- Things we've fixed
We've fixed the refresh on pages like Home and Channels, and the empty state for Search so you see trending queries.

- What's love got to do with it?
Sort an artist's discography by popularity. Easy.
- Flow wherever you go
Flow won't stop playing if your connection drops out! For all paying subscribers, Flow will now start shuffling your downloads if you go offline.

- You're back online!
We’ve implemented a network status bar just for you, so we can tell you when you’ve gone offline and when you’re back online to continue listening.
 
We've made a few changes to the Deezer app. Now there are fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.

- We're beach ready
We've been working out all our bugs so the app is more stable and reliable. Getting ourselves beach ready means nothing will get in the way of you and your Flow on the beach.

- We're beach ready
We've been working out all our bugs so the app is more stable and reliable. Getting ourselves beach ready means nothing will get in the way of you and your Flow on the beach.

In this update, the Artist page tries on its new summer look – you can now swipe left to display the various items in each section.
We also fixed a few bugs on the My Music page and inside playlists, so that nothing comes between you and your music.
Happy holidays!

We also fixed a few bugs on the My Music page and inside playlists, so that nothing comes between you and your music.
Happy holidays!

We also fixed a few bugs on the My Music page and inside playlists, so that nothing comes between you and your music.
Happy holidays!

- Once you were lost but now are found
When you're offline, we'll now tell you why a page can't be displayed with a nifty little error message.

- Once you were lost but now are found

We've made a few changes to the Deezer app. Now there are fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.

- We're beach ready
We've been working out all our bugs so the app is more stable and reliable. Getting ourselves beach ready means nothing will get in the way of you and your Flow on the beach.

- We're beach ready
We've been working out all our bugs so the app is more stable and reliable. Getting ourselves beach ready means nothing will get in the way of you and your Flow on the beach.

We also fixed a few bugs on the My Music page and inside playlists, so that nothing comes between you and your music.

In this update, the Artist page tries on its new summer look – you can now swipe left to display the various items in each section.
We also fixed a few bugs on the My Music page and inside playlists, so that nothing comes between you and your music.
Happy holidays!

Fixing Flow
In this update, we improved Flow to make it a better experience for you: we fixed some general bugs, and the “Add to Playlist” button is now more visible and easier to access inside all Flow playlists.
We also tweaked push notifications, so they always take you to the right place.

Fixing Flow
In this update, we improved Flow to make it a better experience for you: we fixed some general bugs, and the “Add to Playlist” button is now more visible and easier to access inside all Flow playlists.
We also tweaked push notifications, so they always take you to the right place.

General clean-up
We've put our app in order. Less bugs so your app works like a charm.

We've made sure that your dark mode display will not reset to the default display settings anytime you log out of your account.

Now, if you accidentally ban a song, you can tap UNDO in the pop-up confirmation message.

You can now remove an artist from your Flow and personal music recommendations by going to any artist page, and selecting "Don't recommend this artist" in the Options menu. Don't worry, you can tap the same button to add an artist back into your recommendations if you changed your mind.

We've added a "View more" button in your "Recent searches" section so that you can see more results.

General clean-up
We've put our app in order. Less bugs so your app works like a charm.

Watching the Watch
We revamped our Apple Watch UI to make it more intuitive: your favorite tracks are now directly accessible from the homepage, along with the player. We also added a Recently Played section in My Music, and loading times should be faster.
We also updated our app to support right-to-left languages like Modern Standard Arabic, and fixed various bugs.
Finally, we improved the locked-screen player mode so you can seek in the track and skip to the best bit without unlocking. 
Enjoy!

Watching the Watch
We revamped our Apple Watch UI to make it more intuitive: your favorite tracks are now directly accessible from the homepage, along with the player. We also added a Recently Played section in My Music, and loading times should be faster.
We also updated our app to support right-to-left languages like Modern Standard Arabic, and fixed various bugs.
Finally, we improved the locked-screen player mode so you can seek in the track and skip to the best bit without unlocking. 
Enjoy!

A smarter Deezer
With this update, you can better manage explicit content throughout the app with new options in your settings.
On iOS 12, you can now use Siri shortcuts to ask Siri to play your Flow, your Favorite Tracks playlist, and shuffle your music.
We also integrated the Deezer player inside the Waze app, so you can easily listen to your music as you drive. Seamlessly access your Flow, your Favorite Tracks and your Recently Played tracks - and switch between the two apps in one tap.
Finally, we redesigned our Dislike icon to make it easier to understand.
Enjoy!

One for the road
For our last update of the year, we bring you a slew of quality of life upgrades to make your streaming experience the very best it can be.
It's easier than ever to upgrade from Deezer Premium to Deezer Family with a new dedicated option in your account settings.
Some display bugs have been fixed on the artist pages and in the podcast channel.
And that's it for this year! Have a wonderful New Year's Eve, and see you in 2019!

One for the road
For our last update of the year, we bring you a slew of quality of life upgrades to make your streaming experience the very best it can be.
It's easier than ever to upgrade from Deezer Premium to Deezer Family with a new dedicated option in your account settings.
Some display bugs have been fixed on the artist pages and in the podcast channel.
And that's it for this year! Have a wonderful New Year's Eve, and see you in 2019!

You'll now be able to access Favorite Tracks, Artists, and Mixes pages in Offline Mode.
We've labeled your bottom tab bar (Home, My Music, Flow, Search) for faster, smoother navigation.
Lastly, reported bugs concerning My Music, Podcasts, and the way tracks appear in Offline Mode have been addressed.

You can continue browsing content you've already seen in My Music and Channels while in Offline Mode.
We've also made sure that the last song of your shuffle playlist will be played.
In addition, minor bugs concerning the player and the Deezer icon on iPad have been fixed.
Lastly, we've addressed an issue with your downloaded playlists - now, if you add new tracks to a downloaded playlist, they will be downloaded automatically.

We've refreshed the design of your My Music section for added clarity. Page names are now displayed with bigger, bolder text, icons are no longer displayed next to page names, and chevrons have been replaced by number of items in each page.

We've updated the top of your My Music page for a cleaner, easy-to-read display. Your Following and Followers will now be displayed in the Settings page.

We've increased the playlist track limit from 1000 to 2000 tracks.

We've made it so that now more than one item related to your search keywords will be listed in your Top Results.

We've made some technical improvements on the Artist page for faster, smoother performance.

Your search results page display will now be customized according to your subscription for better navigation.

An error message will occur when you try to add a track that has already been added.

We've made some technical improvements on the Artist page for faster, smoother performance.

Your search results page display will now be customized according to your subscription for better navigation.

An error message will occur when you try to add a track that has already been added.

A mini player will now be displayed on the bottom of your screen, so that you can easily play, pause, like a song or go to the next track.

The background color of the full screen and mini player will now continually change to match the album art of the current song.

The Lyrics button on the full screen player has been moved from the center to the bottom right corner of the album art.

We've changed the tab bar from black to white.

We've switched the Flow and My Music tabs.

Exciting news - we've added our new logo! How do you like our new look?

We've put our app in order. Less bugs so your app works like a charm.

Our makeover continues! We’ve added our new Flow logo to match our new vibe.

Good news for CarPlay users - you can now choose ‘repeat one’ to replay a track, or ‘repeat all’ for the whole album/playlist. Pretty useful for road trips.

Our makeover continues! We’ve added our new Flow logo to match our new vibe.

Good news for CarPlay users - you can now choose ‘repeat one’ to replay a track, or ‘repeat all’ for the whole album/playlist. Pretty useful for road trips.

For CarPlay users the option to access your tracklists is back. No need to start from the first track, either. Listen to your tracks in any order.

We've made sure that tracks you've removed from your favorites no longer show up when you shuffle your music - so no nasty surprises when you're getting your groove on.

We've put our app in order. Less bugs so your app works like a charm.
We've put our app in order. Less bugs so your app works like a charm.

You can now share the lyrics to your favorite Deezer tracks to Instagram Stories. Go on - Sharing is caring!

Yet more rebranding? Hey, we can't help it! This time, we've changed our direct play buttons to be a little more consistent with the brand - and a lot easier on the eye.

We've put our app in order. Less bugs so your app works like a charm.

Keep hearing the same song but don't know the name? Good news for iOS users - you can now use SongCatcher to identify songs instantly.

You bring the mood, we bring the music! We've freshened up the Search page with a new style and font, and added the 'Genres, moods and more' category in the Search tab so you can find the right song for any moment.

Can't wait to hear the new music featured on the Deezer homepage? We won't keep you a second longer - literally. Click the play button on any slide to play the song instantly, instead of being directed to the content page.

Calling all premium users! You can now go press the 'back' button to revisit any song in your Flow or your mixes, and you can click on any song played previously in your Queue List.

Keep hearing the same song but don't know the name? Good news for iOS users - you can now use SongCatcher to identify songs instantly.

You bring the mood, we bring the music! We've freshened up the Search page with a new style and font, and added the 'Genres, moods and more' category in the Search tab so you can find the right song for any moment.

Can't wait to hear the new music featured on the Deezer homepage? We won't keep you a second longer - literally. Click the play button on any slide to play the song instantly, instead of being directed to the content page.

Calling all premium users! You can now go press the 'back' button to revisit any song in your Flow or your mixes, and you can click on any song played previously in your Queue List.

We've swapped our old Options menu for a cooler design.

Our SongCatcher was feeling a little blue, so we decided to brighten things up! Now the SongCatcher screen will change colors while it identifies your music.

Not everything's black and white...but your app can be! To come to the dark side, just choose "Dark mode" in "Display settings". Choose "Monochrome player" for a black and white music player.

Deezer Family users can now switch profiles on Google Home & Amazon Alexa.

Switching profiles made easy! You can now choose which profile to use on your Deezer Family account right after the log-in page.

We've added your "Recent searches" to the Search tab, just under the SongCatcher.

If you've ever removed a track from your recommendations, we have good news: you can now put it back in again! Just search for the track, click on the Options menu and select "Allow in my recommendations".

Your Queue list is now on the cloud, which means you'll be able to play your music non-stop across all your devices.

You can now select 'See contributors' in the Options menu to discover who helped create your favorite songs.

We've made some changes to your music player's interface:
- The Ban button has replaced the Shuffle button when playing Flow and all mixes. The Shuffle button will be still available for ordinary playlists and albums. 
- The Options menu has now moved to the center of the row.
- We've added a Share button next to the Options menu button.

Songs identified with SongCatcher will now be displayed in your 'Recent searches' history.

Tracks found from the Search tab will now be followed by tracks with a similar vibe in your music player.

You can now remove an artist from your Flow and personal music recommendations by going to any artist page, and selecting "Don't recommend this artist" in the Options menu. Don't worry, you can tap the same button to add an artist back into your recommendations if you changed your mind.

We've added a "View more" button in your "Recent searches" section so that you can see more results.

We've made sure that your dark mode display will not reset to the default display settings anytime you log out of your account.

Now, if you accidentally ban a song, you can tap UNDO in the pop-up confirmation message.

We've made sure that your dark mode display will not reset to the default display settings anytime you log out of your account.

Now, if you accidentally ban a song, you can tap UNDO in the pop-up confirmation message.

The design of the "Share options" sub-menu has been updated for easier navigation.

There is now a trash bin icon next to "Recent searches" in the Search tab that lets you clear your recent search history.

We've revamped the look of the Flow card on the My Music tab.

Podcast episodes will now appear in your search results.

Podcasts are only available in selected countries.

We've updated the design at the top of every album, artist and playlist page.

On any album page, you can now view other albums by the same artist at the bottom of the page.

There is now a new Shows tab, a dedicated space for you to discover all the podcasts and radio content.

Your Home tab has now been changed to the Music tab. All your mixes with personalized recommendations, including Flow, will appear in one section at the top of the Music tab.

We've added a New releases mix, which recommends new songs based on all the tracks, albums and playlists you like. Don't see this mix yet? Keep adding to your music collection - it will appear once we know what you like!

The old My Music tab has now been renamed to the Favorites tab.

Your app can now adapt to your phone's mode settings by selecting "Automatic" in the app's Display settings.

We've made podcasts easier to navigate. Using the new Search field, you can now find a specific episode on the podcast page. You can also sort episodes by release date in the Latest Episodes playlist.

Apple Watch features a new coral color scheme.

Podcasts are only available in selected countries.

There is now a new Shows tab, a dedicated space for you to discover all the podcasts and radio content.

We've added a New releases mix, which recommends new songs based on all the tracks, albums and playlists you like. Don't see this mix yet? Keep adding to your music collection - it will appear once we know what you like!

Apple Watch features a new coral color scheme.

Podcasts are only available in selected countries.

The Like & Share buttons have moved to the middle of every album, artist, playlist and podcast page.

When selecting a track, all Deezer Free users will soon be able to enjoy a preview of it and directly launch a mix inspired by this track.

Deezer HiFi users can now stream in lossless quality directly on their mobiles. Select High Fidelity in Audio settings.

You can now share directly via Twitter when selecting the Share button.

For our users based in France, you can now keep track of live performances. Go to your favorite artist's page to see if they're on tour and where they're playing.

You can now share music on your Snapchat (feature available with iOS 13 update).

Podcasts you've started will now resume playing from where you left off.

Siri can now handle your music commands. Users with iOS 13 update can tell Siri to play content they want to hear, ranging from specific genres and moods to favorites and playlists.

Users with a paid subscription can now see a Track mix's Queue list and edit it.

Your recent searches will now also include podcast episodes.

We've added "Launch Track mix" in the Options menu.

You can now share lyrics on your Snapchat (feature available with iOS 13 update).

We've added filter options under the search bar when displaying search results.

The ban button is now an angry face. Tap to ban a track/artist from recommendations or change moods.

We've added "Launch Track mix" in the Options menu.

You can now share lyrics on your Snapchat (feature available with iOS 13 update).

We've added filter options under the search bar when displaying search results.

The ban button is now an angry face. Tap to ban a track/artist from recommendations or change moods.

You can now share what you love on Messenger and Facebook from the Options menu. Go on - sharing is caring!

Our Options menu icons have a sleek new look.

You can now share what you love on Messenger and Facebook from the Options menu. Go on - sharing is caring!

Our Options menu icons have a sleek new look.
We've put our app in order. Fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.

For all users with the iOS 13 update, you can now search and play live radio with Siri. Available in Brazil, France, Germany, Israel, Netherlands, South Africa, Spain, UK and USA.

For a better listening experience, we've added volume normalization to equalize the sound of all our content, including music, podcasts and ads. You can change it in your Audio settings.

You can now find the new episodes of your favorite podcasts in the Recently updated section in your Favorites.

Your favorite artists are displayed as such in your search results.

Already listened to a podcast episode? You now have the option to "Mark as played".

For all users with the iOS 13 update, you can ask Siri to search and play podcast episodes.

On artists' and album pages, you can now see featured artists.

Cast is now available for all users, including Deezer Free. The Cast icon can be found at the top right corner.

Already listened to a podcast episode? You now have the option to "Mark as played".

For all users with the iOS 13 update, you can ask Siri to search and play podcast episodes.

On artists' and album pages, you can now see featured artists.

We've revamped our podcast page so you can find what you like instantly. Details like description, release date, and length are now displayed below each episode title. We've even added the download option for easy access.

Cast is now available for all users, including Deezer Free. The Cast icon can be found at the top right corner.

Calling all iOS 13 users, you can now use Siri to find and play all of our podcasts.

Want to hear that again? Use Siri to repeat and shuffle playlists and albums. Available for all users with the iOS 13 update.

Good news, you can now find release dates for new tracks on album pages.

We've put our app in order. Less bugs so your app works like a charm.

Excluded an artist or song from your recommendations and had a change of heart? Search and re-add them to your recommendations from your phone or go to "Manage my exclusions" from the web browser or desktop app.

We know you're home (like us), so we've added a Stay at home channel stocked with playlists to help motivate you throughout your day as you work from home, keep fit, kick back and stay informed.

Fans can now enjoy podcasts in Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates and Egypt. We’ve added a dedicated space for all your podcasts, the Shows.

Excluded an artist or song from your recommendations and had a change of heart? Search and re-add them to your recommendations from your phone or go to "Manage my exclusions" from the web browser or desktop app.

We know you're home (like us), so we've added a Stay at home channel stocked with playlists to help motivate you throughout your day as you work from home, keep fit, kick back and stay informed.

Fans can now enjoy podcasts in Mexico. We've added a dedicated space for all your podcasts, the Shows.

Started a podcast, but weren't able to finish it? We've got you covered. Open up our new "In progress" playlist to pick up where you left off on all the podcasts that you've streamed in the last 15 days.

Calling all free users! We've added a shuffle button on playlists and album covers so that you can now launch them right from your homepage with just one tap.

Fans can now enjoy podcasts in Mexico. We've added a dedicated space for all your podcasts, the Shows.

Started a podcast, but weren't able to finish it? We've got you covered. Open up our new "In progress" playlist to pick up where you left off on all the podcasts that you've streamed in the last 15 days.

Calling all free users! We've added a shuffle button on playlists and album covers so that you can now launch them right from your homepage with just one tap.
There is now a number indicating members remaining under the "Add a profile" section on your family account so that you can know how many more profiles you can add.

Deezer Free users can now find out what artists are featured on editorial playlists pages in our new Featuring section. Wanna go directly to an artist page? Just tap on their name!

We've added an explicit label to certain episodes to help guide you to make the right listening choices for you.

Hey, iOS 13+ users! You will now be able to use third-party authentication to connect to Deezer using your Apple ID. You can also link your Deezer account to your Apple ID through your settings.

Fans can now enjoy podcasts in Israël. We've added a dedicated space for all your podcasts, the Shows.

Keep enjoying tracks picked daily for you in our renamed Daily smart playlists found under Made for you.

Our Flow mix has a new look and feel.

We've updated our communication guidelines regarding password selection to help users pick passwords with strong security levels.

Fans can now enjoy podcasts in GCC, Levant and Maghreb countries.

Good news for our Deezer Family users! You can now invite members on your Deezer Family plan as independent accounts - meaning they'll have their own credentials, added privacy and get to keep their library if they were already using Deezer.

Deezer Free users can now enjoy unlimited skips and pick tracks to play from their Daily and Recommended playlists. *Not available in the US

Great news — you can now browse podcasts by duration!

We've reorganized the Manage my account section so that users can now find all authentication methods including Facebook, Google and Apple in one place.
Wanna get updates about new releases from your favorite podcasts? Just tap on Notify me about new episodes to turn on updates.

CarPlay users, here's some good news for you: We've cleaned up our app with a new design, are bringing you more content with fresh, new mixes and have even added an explicit label to help you recognize explicit content.

Wanna test out CarPlay? We've opened up the feature to Deezer Free users so that they can now take CarPlay for a spin.

CarPlay users, here's some good news for you: We've cleaned up our app with a new design, are bringing you more content with fresh, new mixes and have even added an explicit label to help you recognize explicit content.

Wanna test out CarPlay? We've opened up the feature to Deezer Free users so that they can now take CarPlay for a spin.

CarPlay users: wanna find all your favorite content in one place? We've gathered up your top listens and added them all to a new Favorites tab so that you now can!

We've freshened up our app by adding a new design to our Share options menu.

To keep your music flowing, tracks that aren't fully downloaded will now be auto skipped when listening offline.

Good news for CarPlay users – there are now two new tabs perfect for all your listening needs. Can't decide what to play next? Turn up our new Live radio tab. Love podcasts? Listen to them now in CarPlay under your Podcasts tab.

We've also added a Recently played and Downloaded section to your Favorites tab.
You now have Country selector in your Settings to get the best local recommendations on your Music & Shows tabs — change countries as much as you'd like, and discover!

Good news — we've improved offline searching to make it easier to find tracks! Tracks that have been downloaded in playlists and albums will now show up in search results, making searching offline easier than ever before!

We've improved the channels! Find more Editors' picks & a wider selection of updated playlists faster, and get a quick view of playlist descriptions!

On a Deezer Family plan? You can now set your profile as an independent account with your own login details for private access. Just head to 'Account Settings' in the web browser!
No time to waste? You can now add SongCatcher and Flow widgets directly to your home screen. For users of iOS 14 update.

New for iOS 14 users: now you can get to your favorites fast with the new "Favorite tracks" widget.

We've added a download button in the player so that fans can easily download their favorite podcasts and listen anytime and anywhere.

More widgets! iOS 14 users can now add a "Made for you" widget that includes Flow and all smart playlists.

We've revamped our Favorites tab with unique sections for both music and podcasts.

Admins on Deezer Family can now allow or block explicit content for other accounts on the same plan.

More widgets! iOS 14 users can now add a "Made for you" widget that includes Flow and all smart playlists.

We've revamped our Favorites tab with unique sections for both music and podcasts.

Admins on Deezer Family can now allow or block explicit content for other accounts on the same plan.

For iOS 14 users: new medium and large widgets for quick access to your Recently played content.

We've added access to your Notifications and Settings from every tab for a smoother experience.

You can now add new tracks to your most recently updated playlist by opening the Options menu from the track.

You can now add new tracks to your most recently updated playlist by opening the Options menu from the track.

#MyDeezerYear is back with all your top artists, songs, and highlights of the year!

Drift into dreamland with our new sleep timer. Accessible from the player, you can end playback at a certain time in case you fall asleep!

If you have iOS 14, you can now add a medium or large Favorite playlists widget on your home screen for quicker access.

We've refreshed the look for your player with new Audio and Queue list icons.

We've revamped the layout of your Settings to give you a fresh, new experience.

Happy New Year!
We've put our app in order. Fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.
We've put our app in order. Fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.
The track cells have been refreshed for a clearer and more harmonious design.

We've redesigned the artist header in the track's Options menu. You can now go to any main artist or contributing artist's page instantly by tapping on their name or picture.

Profile pages got a makeover! Now enjoy larger profile pictures and a sleek new design.

Need help building the perfect playlist? Our new feature for personal playlists gives you a list of suggested, favorite, and top tracks when you tap the "Add tracks" button.

Sharing just got easier. Now when you take a screenshot of a track, lyrics screen, artist, podcast, or playlist page, a link to the page is automatically copied.

Your share icon has changed! Instead of the arrow, you now have Apple's classic box with arrow share icon.

You'll now have animated video backgrounds when you share tracks to your Facebook and Instagram stories.

We now give you the option to self-identify as "non-binary" when you sign up for the first time.

Great news for our super likers! You can now add up to 10,000 tracks to your Favorites.

Creating playlists just got better! Now you can select the "Collaborative" playlist option to curate tracks with your loved ones no matter the distance.
We've spruced up the look of your Search tab with a cleaner and more colorful design! You can now scroll down to browse by channel.
We've put our app in order. Fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.

Creating new playlists will now bring you to the new playlist page instead of back to your Playlists section - no more extra taps, just start adding tracks!

Want to expand your favorites? There is now an “Add tracks” button on your “Favorite tracks” page, making it easier than ever to grow your personal playlists.

All of our users can now discover and enjoy podcasts from around the world thanks to the dedicated Podcasts tab.

We've added an Audio output menu! Open by tapping the icon in the bottom-left corner of your music player. This will give you quick access to your Audio settings, equalizer, volume bar, and connected devices.

Apple Watch users: you can now download and manage your playlists directly on your watch and listen to your favorites offline! There's also a brand new look & feel to the smartwatch app that will improve your experience.

Apple Watch users: if you have Deezer Free, your app experience just got better! Enjoy tracks, albums, and playlists in shuffle mode and easily access your Queue list, all from your wrist.

We've improved Notifications! Tap the bell icon in the top-right corner to view releases, & like artists you love to get relevant alerts.

Notifications get even more personal! You now have a "Choose artists" button at the bottom of your notifications list, so that you can tell us which artists you love and receive more relevant alerts.

We've revamped the look of your artist page! Easily read artist bios by tapping the icon in the top-right corner.
Now when you build playlists using the "Add tracks" button, you can hear a 30-second preview of any listed track to see if you like it before adding!
We've put our app in order. Fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.
Want to know if lyrics are available for a song? Look out for the Lyrics icon on the bottom player when a song is playing or selected.
We've put our app in order. Fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.
We've put our app in order. Fewer bugs so your app works like a charm.
We have no major updates to report so we thought we'd use this opportunity to tell you something you probably don't know - some cats are allergic to people. Take care out there and stay safe.
We have no major updates to report so we thought we'd use this opportunity to tell you something you probably don't know - some cats are allergic to people. Take care out there and stay safe.

Discover the most popular radios in your country with the new Radio icon. Look out for it in the top right corner of your screen. Radios are only available in Brazil, France, Germany, the Netherlands and Spain.

You can now edit your profile picture directly from your settings by tapping on Account management.

Your favorite tracks are now accessible only from the Favorites tab.

Want to make your device a remote? Our team is rolling out the first version of the remote control experience that grants you the possibility to control the Deezer app (iOS, web, or desktop app) with your mobile device and/or tablet. To use it, just activate it in our Deezer Labs on your favorite devices.

We made you a brand new temporary playlist of 50 tracks you've been jamming out to this season. To find your top summer or top winter songs (depending on which one you're leaving), head over to the Made for you section in the app, press play and relive those memories.

Want to make your device a remote? Our team is rolling out the first version of the remote control experience that grants you the possibility to control the Deezer app (iOS, web, or desktop app) with your mobile device and/or tablet. To use it, just activate it in our Deezer Labs on your favorite devices.

We made you a brand new temporary playlist of 50 tracks you've been jamming out to this season. To find your top summer or top winter songs (depending on which one you're leaving), head over to the Made for you section in the app, press play and relive those memories.

iOS 14 users can now jump back to previously visited pages at the click of a button. To see the list of pages, scroll up to the top left corner then press and hold down the back button within the app. A list of previously viewed pages will appear and you can head back to any page you want.

We've upgraded your Flow to make it even more personal! With Flow Moods, whether you're at the gym or chillin' in bed, tune your Flow to your current mindset! It's simple really. Click on the Flow icon at the top of your player, pick one of the 6 available moods (You & Me, Motivation, Chill, Melancholy, Focus and Party) from the wheel and enjoy!
